post.title: EnerBank Grows Its Executive Team
post.content:
Kristin Dittmer has been promoted to Executive Vice President of Finance and Credit and former GE Capital Bank Models and Quantitative Risk Leader Robb Kerry has been added as the new Senior Vice President and Chief Credit Officer.

Dittmer joined EnerBank in 2010 as Senior Vice President and Chief Credit Officer. Prior to joining EnerBank, she was Credit Card Manager and Chief Credit Officer at BMW Bank. She began her banking career as a Financial Examiner for the Utah Department of Financial Institutions.

Dittmer currently serves on the Credit Committee of the non-profit Utah Small Business Growth Initiative and as the Vice Chair of the Utah Association of Financial Services CFO Roundtable Committee. She earned her Bachelor of Science in Finance and a Master of Business Administration from the University of Utah.

“Kristin has had a tremendous impact on the business,” says Louise Kelly, President and CEO of EnerBank. “Her expanded leadership role at EnerBank will help us continue to achieve our growth goals. We welcome Robb to the leadership team, and are excited about what he will contribute to our business.”

As Chief Credit Officer, Kerry reports to Dittmer and oversees all credit functions at the Bank, including underwriting criteria, credit trends and risk management and monitoring. Kerry was previously at GE Capital Bank where he spent the past 5 years as the Models and Quantitative Risk Leader focused on implementing and overseeing their Model Risk Management Program. Kerry has also been Chief Credit Officer at both ADB Bank and Cache Valley Bank. He began his banking career as a Financial Examiner for the Utah Department of Financial Institutions. Kerry received his Master of Business Administration and Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration and Spanish from Weber State University. He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst® designation.
